title: Arsenal linked with two wingers in transfer window - and one tormented Tottenham
text:

Arsenal have been linked with two wingers, according to reports from the continent - and one of them tormented rivals Tottenham in the Champions League recently.

Daniel Podence fired eight goals and nine assists for Olympiacos last season, and has netted two for the Greek side already this term.

The left winger was a handful for Tottenham as they blew a 2-0 lead to draw 2-2 with Olympiacos in their Champions League opener last month - scoring one of his side's goals and prompting some Arsenal fans to compare him to Real Madrid ace Eden Hazard on Twitter .

And now Arsenal are one of two Premier League clubs making enquiries about the 23-year-old, according to Greek publication Sportime .

The publication says Olympiacos would want around £21.5million for Podence - while Arsenal would face competition from the other, unnamed Premier League club who are also interested.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Another winger Arsenal are reportedly looking at is Real Madrid's Lucas Vazquez, who the Gunners were linked with over the summer.

Right winger Vazquez has been on the fringes of the Madrid team so far this season, and Spanish publication El Desmarque says the 28-year-old already has offers on the table from Arsenal, Rome and Bayer Leverkusen ahead of a possible January move.

He has found himself behind Vinicius Junior and Rodrygo in the thoughts of Real manager Zinedine Zidane - although he has managed one goal in six La Liga appearances so far this season.

(Image: REUTERS)

He could be open to a move when the transfer window opens in the new year, although Arsenal would have to cough up around £13m.

Arsenal signed Nicolas Pepe for £72m in the summer, while they also have teenagers Reiss Nelson and Bukayo Sako in their ranks - so it remains to be seen whether Arsenal boss Unai Emery will splash out on any more wingers either in January or next summer.
description: Gunners have been linked with Real Madrid's Lucas Vazquez and Daniel Podence of Olympiacos
